instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message:
Board history: Liquid, attempted repair.

All the usual rails are fine.

Been all over testing this board am lost at this point.


L7550 to ground 1.5 ohm
L7510 to ground 2 ohm (get the same on donor boards but nothing working to reference)

PPVCORE_S0_CPU = 0v
PPVCORE_S0_AXG = 0v
CPUIMVP_TON = 0.7v
CPUIMVP_PGOOD = 0.5v


PPVCCAS_S0_CPU = 0.9v
PP1V05_S0 = 1.5v
PP1v8_s0 = 1v8



What do I need to be looking for please?

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Gurmon, post: 22751"]Whats the value of ALL_SYS_PWRGD ?[/QUOTE]

ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0.07v

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message: ALL_SYS should of course be there. There is a rail missing.....

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22756"]ALL_SYS should of course be there. There is a rail missing.....[/QUOTE]

Sure, I did miss one. R2805 was missing from the board (Not a no stuff right?) Fan spins now.
Now there is no chime, no mouse LED, no PRAM reset.... Now to find the issue there.

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD now 3v3. PP1V5 is now present.

Still no vcore

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message: Yeah and how did that resistor end up missing? Inspect for more damage, there is more you missed.

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22802"]Yeah and how did that resistor end up missing? Inspect for more damage, there is more you missed.[/QUOTE]

eBay board. And yes clearly.

This board is really doing my nut.

Could this be SPIROM? Missing PM signal? PCH? Fucked up trace / Resistor / cap?

Here are few measurements but what do I need to be looking for please..... Any clues?

ALL_SYS =3v3
CPUIMVP_TON = 0.35v
CPUIMVP_VR_ON =3.3v
CPUIMVP_PGOOD = 0.06v

CPUIMVP_BOOT1G is 4.8v
CPIIMVP_BOOT1_RC is 4.8v

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message: Ebay garbage. Any missing/damaged resistor can cause this. Why do you pick up this garbage?

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22966"]Ebay garbage. Any missing/damaged resistor can cause this. Why do you pick up this garbage?[/QUOTE]
I'll send it back for a refund.

threads.title: 820-3209 no vcore
threads.message: Uhm I assume you bought this as non-working?
